VIEW_NORMAL

public static final View.CameraMode VIEW_NORMAL
Geometry will be rendered like normal geometry with the camera in its current location. This field is set in Background and Foreground NodeS.

VIEW_FIXED_POSITION

public static final View.CameraMode VIEW_FIXED_POSITION
Geometry will be rendered with the camera in the same location but with the camera facing its current direction. This field is set in Background and Foreground NodeS.

VIEW_FIXED

public static final View.CameraMode VIEW_FIXED
Geometry will be rendered with the camera in the same location and facing the same directrion This field is set in Background and Foreground NodeS.

getViewTransform

public Transform3D getViewTransform(View.CameraMode mode)
Gets view transform adjusting it depending on the camera mode.

Parameters:
mode - VIEW_NORMAL will return the standard view, VIEW_FIXED_POSITION will return only the rotational component of the standard view (the position is left as the identity), VIEW_FIXED returns the identity matrix.

setTransparencySortingPolicy

public void setTransparencySortingPolicy(int policy)
Sets the transparency sorting policy for this view. This attribute is one of:
- TRANSPARENCY_SORT_NONE, to specify that no depth sorting of transparent objects is performed. Transparent objects are drawn after opaque objects, but are not sorted from back to front.
- TRANSPARENCY_SORT_GEOMETRY, to specify that transparent objects are depth-sorted on a per-geometry basis. Each geometry object of each transparent Shape3D node is drawn from back to front. Note that this policy will not split geometry into smaller pieces, so intersecting or intertwined objects may not be sorted correctly.
- TRANSPARENCY_SORT_BOUNDING_SPHERE_AND_EYE_RAY_INTERSECTION, to specify that transparent objects are depth-sorted on a per-geometry basis, using bounding shpere - eye ray intersection as reference point. Note that this policy also will not split geometry into smaller pieces.
The default policy is TRANSPARENCY_SORT_GEOMETRY.

Parameters:
policy - - the new policy, one of TRANSPARENCY_SORT_NONE, TRANSPARENCY_SORT_GEOMETRY or TRANSPARENCY_SORT_BOUNDING_SPHERE_AND_EYE_RAY_INTERSECTION

getTransparencySortingPolicy

public int getTransparencySortingPolicy()

setOpaqueSortingPolicy

public void setOpaqueSortingPolicy(int policy)
Sets the opaque sorting policy for this view. This attribute is one of:
- OPAQUE_SORT_BY_SHADERS, to specify that rendering engine should draw opaque objects in the order that minimizes shader state changes.
- OPAQUE_SORT_FRONT_TO_BACK, to specify that opaque objects are depth-sorted on a per-geometry basis. Each geometry object of each opaque Shape3D node is drawn from front to back. Note that this policy will not split geometry into smaller pieces, so intersecting or intertwined objects may not be sorted correctly.
- OPAQUE_SORT_NONE, to specify that no sorting of opaque objects is performed.
The default policy is OPAQUE_SORT_BY_SHADERS.

Parameters:
policy - - the new policy, one of OPAQUE_SORT_BY_SHADERS, OPAQUE_SORT_FRONT_TO_BACK or OPAQUE_SORT_NONE

public int getOpaqueSortingPolicy()

renderOnce

public void renderOnce()
renders a single frame to all canvases attached to the view. This will collect all the renderable atoms and load up the renderer. A rander frame will then be created and passed to all canvases

setBackgroundChanged

public void setBackgroundChanged(boolean changed)
Set "background changed" flag. Renderer implementation checks this flag if background caching mechanisms enabled. Application should not reset this flag to false, because of it may cause unpredictable results.

Parameters:
changed - New value for "background changed" flag

isBackgroundChanged

public boolean isBackgroundChanged()
Returns current value of "background changed" flag. Can be used by Renderer implementation to check if background has been changed since last rendering.
